headline: Toscana Soup
description: This soup is sure to warm your bones on a chilly night and won't leave you hungry. Potatoes, sausage and kale are simmered in chicken broth and cream, with onions and garlic.
name: Toscana Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Place sausage links on a baking sheet and bake 25 minutes, or until cooked through. Slice into 1/2 inch slices.
Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute onions until translucent; add garlic and cook 1 minute.
Stir in broth, water and potatoes; simmer 15 minutes.
Reduce heat to low and add sausage, kale and cream; simmer until heated through and serve.

review.reviewBody: We absolutely love this recipe. I added extra potatoes, minced, garlic, a teaspoon of red pepper flakes, and some Italian seasoning. Before serving we add Parmesan cheese to the soup.
I used sweet Italian sausage and spinach. I tossed in a tbsp of red pepper flakes. Really a hardy soup on a cold evening!
This is an excellent recipe! I will definitely make this again! The entire family loved it. Thank You for the recipe!
DELICIOUS!! We don't eat pork, so I made it with ground turkey Italian style sausage. I also added crushed red pepper and extra kale per other reviewers' suggestion. Would ABSOLUTELY make it again.
The broth was lacking flavor. I won’t make this again.
So delicious. I added red pepper flakes, more potatoes and homeade smoked bacon bits. Keeping this recipe to make more. Thank you!
this was so yummy! and easy to double. we added some basil and pepper, but it was perfect!
This is a good recipe. I used ground spicy Italian sausage and added bacon and crushed red peppers. I will definitely be making my modified version of the again.
I made it with tofurky Sausage and added 3 cups mushrooms and non dairy cream so so good!!!

Excellent. Instead of kale, I used frozen spinach. And since I didn't have heavy cream, I used evaporated milk. And lastly, instead of baking the sausage, I sliced them up and fried them. Yum. Came out very tasty.
So good!! I also added parm, red chilli flakes and thickened it up with corn starch. Which IMO are all necessary
Wonderful! I used ground Italian sausage and spinach and it was awesome!
I added more water and more cream I like it creamy

I've used a very similar recipe to this for 20 years. Guests love it. I have made it without sausage for vegetarians and it was still very good. For chicken stock, I find Wyler's Chicken Bouillion about 1.5 tablespoons really gives great flavor. And it's easier to store dry bouillion.

Love this recipe! I used linguica and put twice the collards (that’s what I had in my garden) than the recipe called for and let it simmer a while before I put in the potatoes. Added a dash of red pepper flakes and used sour cream since I didn’t have cream. Oh and I added black beans. Delicious.
Like this recipe but prefer it with ground sausage instead; however, we’ve made it with cubed pork as well. It’s just a good recipe perfect for a soup kind of day!
Favorite soup!

I've made this more times than I can recall at this point and have tried several of my own variations at this point as a result. I usually use whole milk (it's what I always have on hand), mild browned ground sausage instead of spicy (so the kids will eat it), and add some crushed red pepper flakes to the adults bowls when it's finished. Amazing. My favorite soup. Very forgiving with mixing things up as needed. Perfect as written, but easy to make kid friendly.
We loved this soup, however I rated it a 4 star because I made many of the edits and additions suggested by others.

I am lactose intolerant so I just omitted the cream and it’s still really good. Also my husband, who doesn’t like soups because they generally don’t fill him, loved this - without it’s creamy goodness and all. I will definitely be making it again.
added a little extra seasoning

I have less-common food allergies, so I make my sausage from loose ground pork and add in my own seasonings. Used Yukon gold potatoes and evaporated milk instead of cream because that’s what I had on hand. Turned out great. I did add a lot of black and white pepper and it worked well. Very picky eater liked it a lot and requested the extras for lunch the next day.
Substituted Purnell's spicy medium ground sausage for links and turnips for potatoes. Increased cream to 3/4 Cup.

I love love love this soup. I make it a few times a month and usually add two cans of white beans as well as more potatoes and kale to make it thicker and heartier. It’s so quick and it’s absolutely amazing.
It takes some time, but it's worth it... so good...
Perfect for a winter evening.
I loved it as a "base" recipe. I added some sour cream, used spicy Italian sausage, and red pepper flakes. Delicious.

Sooooo good!!!! I used a package of crumbled sausage and doubled the potatoes, cream, water and chicken bouillon. Like most other reviewers, I also added crushed red pepper. I found it easier to cook the sausage in the soup pan first and then added everything else in as directed. I also used spinach instead of kale and added right before serving. What a hit!!! I will definitely make this again.
Honestly, I didnt measure, but after working for OG I didnt really need to. Made it. The ingredients work. Thanks again allrecipes members!
delicious!!
So good. I don't care if it is or isn't like OG (though it really is, strikingly so). It's just delicious.
I made it and it was really good. When doubling the recipe and I would recommend not doubling the amount of sausage. It was a bit too much.
Delicious soup. Simple t o make. I used half and half in place of the cream and added white pepper.
My 3 yr old loved it.... I can officially stop going to Olive Garden to pick up a gallon bucket once a month lol.
We ended up using smoked sausage and a can of chicken broth for some of the water . . . with a little less of the chicken base then, of course. It was fabulous.
Ummm this is absolutely delicious. Tried a couple versions of this soup and this is the best. Kale is much better than spinach for this soup but be careful, do not over cook it! You’ll love it!!

I didn't really know what to expect as I've never had this at OG, but it was delicious. I did follow some of the reviewer suggestions and added crushed red pepper. I also made bulk Italian pork sausage rather than bake the sausage links. Ultimately, I definitely will be making this one again.

This was a horrible recipe. Even after simmering for 4hrs, the textire of the kale maintained stiff. The spicy sausage flavor did not mix w the kale at all. I tried everything to save it but in the end the entire pot of soup went in the garbage. I was very disappointed esp bcz it was so easy to make.
Delicious! Me and hubby made this for a cantata banquet for 200 people. It was super easy and everyone loved it. Many people asked for the recipe. Will make again and again.

This is delicious. I did make a few adjustments because of some comments and I’m glad I did. I used ground sausage, extra potatoes, red pepper flakes, and thickened with cornstarch. Fast and easy to make. We will definitely have this again at our house!

This recipe needed improvement so I added fried up bacon & mild Italian sausage. Used chicken Broth, not water. Added a good pinch of red pepper flakes.
It was a 5 Star after that !
Delicious. Made this with Turkey sausage and added a bit more garlic since we like garlic, but other than that made exactly as written.
This soup is wonderful! Much better than OG.

This was really good!! I couldn’t find any good looking sausages, so I used ground maple sausage. The chicken base made it a bit too salty for me hence the 4 instead of 5 stars. My 2 and 4 year old picky eaters ate a ton of this stuff!! We will be making it again for sure.

Missing Oregino and a Bay Leaf. Chopped Peppers or even chili flakes help. I use chicked stock and not a cube with water.. Still a great simple soup. I prefer to crumble the sausage cook it with the onion and then add chicken stock.
This is one of the favorite soups at my home now. I made few changes, I used spring onion instead of kale which really taste good. Now my kids wants it at least once a week
This was horrible, the combination of potatoes and red pepper really turned me off. Really disappointing.
Fast, easy and delicious! I made it as a vegetarian dish using vegetable stock, instead of water and chicken base, and spicy veggie Italian sausage. More potato and a whole bunch of kale. Delish!

I have celiac disease and can longer dine at that infamous beloved Italian restaurant. This soup is Spot. On. It's wonderful to have a perfect replacement that I can make in the safety and security of my own gluten free home.
Perfect!! So good!!! Just add some chicken boullion! Great tip anytime u need a little flavor just add chicken boullion??

This soup Is delicious ! I Doubled it and cooked the spicy sausage in a frying pan Instead of in the oven. I also cut up some baby carrots and threw those in along with the Potatoes. Always looking for more ways to get vegetables into the hubby. He loved it and went back for seconds!

My husband and I are watching what we eat and my family eats at all different times - I tried this dish because it was all in one. We loved it!! I used sweet potatoes instead of regular and it was great. it was very satisfying, nutritious and delicious!! I was so happy with this recipe.
My husband love it!!! Turned out great

We enjoyed this soup very much. I did make minor changes. I used whole milk in stead of the heavy cream. I also purchased hot Italian sausage loose (not in casing). It was delicious but next time I will try it with sweet Italian sausage. I also used 10 oz. of kale. I separated the kale from the thick stem. I will definitely make this again! Thanks to the submitter of this recipe!
Very good soup. I didn't add any salt or regular pepper but did add some red pepper flakes to make it even more spicy. Even my husband liked it with the kale and he's very fussy about veggies.

Fantastic!!! I won't downgrade this because everyone is free to implement changes on their own specific taste but if you're a beginner my recommendation would be adding extra kale, sausage and potato if you like soup loaded with goodies!

Gave it 4 stars instead of the 5 due to proportions. Cooked 5 mild Italian turkey sausage (and there was plenty) with the onions and then the potatoes. When they were cooked through, i sliced them. Used 2 large red potatoes (@4 cups) sliced thin. And had red kale, which I used. Added 2 1/2 cups more broth. Since I used mild sausage, I added red pepper when served. To cook ahead, make the soup and leave out cream. Add cream when reheating.
I added red pepper flakes. Better than any restaurant!
Subbed potatoes with riced cauliflower and I used ground sausage instead of links (hot sausage for extra heat)!
This is a delicious soup , easy to make and a real hit with the family.
was ok
Delicious and simple simple to make. Loved this recipe

I've made it twice using different sausages and both times turned out really good! I used turkey Italian sausage the first time and chicken Italian sausage the second time. I also used all chicken broth without water the first time and used both chicken broth and water the second time. They both tasted exactly the same. You can really play around with this dish using different ingredients. It's a new staple in our house for those cold nights.
Tasted great and was easy to make. Will definitely stay on my "go-to" list.

IT was AWESOME after adding more spices. I think the recipe needs more spices, I was warned by the other reviewers that it turned out bland, so I decided not to let that happen. I used a couple pinches of the following and it was GREAT!!!!!!!!!!!

- 1/2 tbls spoon dried crushed oregano 
- two pinches coriander
- two pinches cardamom
-salt and pepper to taste
We loved it. I did change it a bit mainly because I didn't have the Italian sausage, I used smoked sausage link and I used spinach with crumbled bacon on top. Will make this many more times.

Soups are my favorite thing to make,and I make quite a bit. Last time I made this exact as recipe-fantastic! this time I did spinach. I also used chicken broth and a full 4 cups of chicken base, used 1/2 & 1/2 instead. This time its just as divine! Used 6 sweet sausage w/caseing pulled off,cut up. Added a little sage and rosemary,wow-this soup is yummy! Hubby lovs it too!
simple and delicious..used a breakfast sausage links...probably used 3 cups of potato as i like a hearty soup...
Fabulous! I added 1/2 tsp red chili flakes to spice it slightly and it was perfect!

Very yummy!! It does turn out a bit watery for my taste. I read the reviews and I added 2 extra potatoes, then I took about 1/4 to 1/3 of the finished product and puréed it in the blender, then returned it to the pot. This helped to thicken it. I added the spinach last (I substituted spinach for the kale; not a big kale fan). Will definitely be making this again!!!

Better than the OG! Love this stuff, cues any virus lol. I used bulk hot Italian sausage, browned it in my cast iron Dutch oven (it's fairly small), scooted it over, cooked the onions, moved them over, cooked the garlic for a minute, stirred it all together, added 4 cups of chicken broth, then the rest as in the recipe - added the potatoes, simmered for 15 minutes, then LOTS of kale. I don't add the cream until serving so I can reheat easily. Plus, it's so good I skip the cream half the time.
I will make it so many more times it was so delicious he whole family loved it!!

Love this recipe. Followed some of the suggestions from other reviewers...like cooking the onion in bacon grease instead of vegetable oil and I added sliced mushrooms and red pepper flakes. I was going to use cornstarch to thicken it up when I realized I didn't have any. So I decided to mash some of the potatoes. That did the trick. I also added grated Parmesan at the end. This is a keeper. Even the hubby loved it. Delicious!

I think the taste is superb, but I think the next time I make it , I will thicken it; just a little.
Good winter soup.

Nothing better than a hot soup that is healthy. Very good.
Thanks for the recipe.
One of my favorite soups... like Olive Garden but way better!
Excellent. A regular meal in our household now.
I used Italian spicy turkey sausage. My batch turned out great!
We have the best spicy sausage ground daily at our local grocery store; used this along with chicken stock , fabulous!
Love this soup!

Good base recipe but I took a few shortcuts: used a box of dried scalloped potatoes and half a bag table-ready chopped kale salad mix, added white beans and used milk instead of cream to lower fat content. Removed casing from one large link sweet Italian sausage, broke link up into small bits before frying in pot used for the soup. Soaked 1 tsp fennel seeds in some boiling water and added just the water to the soup to boost the sausage flavor. The sauce mix from the scalloped potatoes gave the soup the creamy texture needed; finished it with a little white wine. I'll make it again.

This recipe was amazing! I used regular rolled hot sausage (1/2 pack) and used 6 cups of water, I scrambled my sausage then added my onions and followed the recipe from there. I also used three tablespoons of soup base.
Better than Olive Garden

I just got done making this and it turned out really well. I cut back on the soup base (used 2 teaspoons not tablespoons) and used two cups of water and two cups of low sodium chicken broth. I had kielbasa so that's the meat I used and it turned out well. Only rated four stars for the sake of having to tweak so many things
This soup is excellent! I've made it several times and love it.

Add :
I used sweet Italian Sausage (casing removed, browned on stovetop over low/medium heat).
-1 handful of dried marjoram
-1 handful of dried thyme
-Salt and pepper to taste
-Substitute cream with evaporated milk
-2 cartons of chicken broth
(Omit water)
-1 crushed chicken bouillon cube
- Added extra cut potatoes to help thicken...
So good!!!
Used jimmy dean ground sausage browned on the stove instead. Loved it
This was way better than Olive Garden. I used olive oil instead of vegetable oil and added some red pepper flakes and additional seasonings while sautéing the onions.
Yummy!

Super good meal! I just used four cups of chicken broth comma instead of the chicken soup base. I just used regular ground hot spicy sausage and leftover potato boil potatoes from the night before. everybody gobble it up to the last drop. It was pretty good.
I added 1 additional potato and pureed it to make the soup liquid a little thicker. Also added a dash of Tabasco and some ground pepper. Will definitely make it again.

My husband and I made this tonight and it exceeded our expectations! We used Aidells Italian style chicken sausage, all chicken broth in place of the water, and salt, pepper, and a little Mrs. Dash Italian seasoning. Fantastic!
Instead of using 4 cups of water and 2 tables spoons of chicken broth, I reversed it and used 4 cups of chicken broth and 2 tables spoons of water.
Loosely follow instructions yet always end up with something delicious.

I LOVE IT!! I read all the comments and used a lot of the suggestions. I actually used one pot. I added the sausage at the same time with all the other ingredients and boiled until potatoes were soft. Did the taste test, added more seasoning and crushed red pepper, then finished it off with the cream and kale. I think this helped it with flavor putting it all in at the same time to simmer. I'll have this for a winter meal quite a few times. thanks

My husband has heart disease so I made a low fat version by substituting chicken tenderloin strips for the sausage; and skim milk and nonfat plain yogurt for the water and heavy cream. It was terrific! Had guests over the first time I made it and they loved it too. Everyone had two big bowls! Sauteed the chicken in olive oil and poultry seasoning.

I make Tuscana Soup all the time cuz family and I love it! I used to make this recipe this way when I first tried to recreate it but now I've stepped it up a bit so it's not so blah! These are my changes that I made a long time ago! I use 3 leeks (white parts only, sliced & cut into 2" segments & rinsed of sand) & some chopped onion too! I use 1/2 hot Italian sausages & 1/2 sweet or all sweet, then add pinches of crushed red pepper! (I find it is better to take casings off of the sausages first then crumble & pan sauté, easier to chew & chunks not so large!) I make sure I pack plenty of potatoes & all other ingredients into the soup because I take a 1/3 out and puree them, then put it back into the soup which thickens the broth. Oh yes, I use chicken broth only & salt/fresh ground black pepper to taste too! The cream is important, don't skip!enjoy!

Made it for my husband and I. First try was a success! If you are not big on spicy though, I would suggest adding mild Italian sausage and adjusting the spice level by adding cayenne pepper to the broth.
I used ground italian sausage instead of the links but everything else was the same and it was delicious! We will definitely be keeping this recipe.
